<p><a href="https://nodejs.org/en/blog/release/v4.0.0/">Node.js 4.0.0</a> just got released! The jump from 0.12.x<br> to 4.0 is a huge one, especially since it incorporates lots of changes that happened<br> over at the IO.js project. So far, I haven’t experienced a lot of issues with it, and it<br> quickly became the one version that I use as default on my system. However, there are some<br> hickups here and there. Here I try to collect some issues with Gulp.js and first aid<br> solutions. There are few and they might be out of date quickly.</p> <h2>Segmentation fault</h2> <p>If you run your Gulp build, it might happen that you experience the following output:</p> <pre><code>Segementation fault </code></pre> <p>This one leaves you with no information, but the solution is rather straightforward:<br> Re-install your Node.js dependencies:</p> <pre><code>$ rm -rf node_modules $ npm install </code></pre> <p>And you should be ready to go again. Frederic gives more help here:</p> <blockquote class="twitter-tweet" lang="de"><p lang="en" dir="ltr"><a href="https://twitter.com/ddprrt">@ddprrt</a> Yes, all native modules require recompiling against latest V8 (best using nan@3).</p>&mdash; Frederic Hemberger (@fhemberger) <a href="https://twitter.com/fhemberger/status/641981760688005120">10. September 2015</a></blockquote> <script async src="//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script> <h2>libsass bindings not found</h2> <p>If you use <code>gulp-sass</code> with the native C++ implementation of Sass, you might end up<br> with the following error:</p> <pre><code>Error: `libsass` bindings not found in /[PROJECT DIRECTORY]/trunk/node_modules/gulp-sass/node_modules/node-sass/vendor/linux-x64-14/binding.node. Try reinstalling `node-sass`? </code></pre> <p>There are some dependency conflicts inside <code>libsass</code>, which we can resolve by moving<br> to an earlier version of Sass.</p> <pre><code>$ npm uninstall gulp-sass node-sass $ npm install node-sass@1.0.3 $ npm install gulp-sass </code></pre> <h2>That’s it</h2> <p>Up until now, I haven’t found anymore issues. Will keep you posted if there are more</p>
